result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Koslica was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically individual or collective counseling regarding the  marriage.  No violent contact with the victim. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Nicholas R Koslica in court with attorney Robert F Sfasciotti.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State indicates that the file was misplaced, therefore, subpoena's were not done for the JT date and the State does not have the investigation report from policing agency. That State is asking for another STC and final pretrial based upon that information and due to the defense's motion for judicial notice. Defense indicates that their motion to take judicial notice was brought to the prosecutor's attention previously and defense isn't sure what new investigation the State is referencing. 

BTC: The Court finds good cause to remove the case from the trial calendar. JT may be adj. New STC/FPT to be scheduled as well.  Status conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
